t: Isaiah 26
A Song of Salvation
In*p that day this song will be sung in the land of Judah: “We*pn have a strong city; God*ild will appoint salvation for*i walls and bulwarks.
Open*ld the gates, That*ld the righteous nation which keeps the truth may enter in.
You*ld will keep him*i in perfect peace, Whose*ild mind is*i stayed on*i You,*i Because*ld he trusts in You.
Trust*ld in the Lord*s forever, For*ld in YAH, the Lord,*s is*i everlasting strength.
For*ld He brings down those who dwell on high, The*ld lofty city; He*ld lays it low, He*ld lays it low to the ground, He*ld brings it down to the dust.
The*ld foot shall tread it down— The*ld feet of the poor And*ild the steps of the needy.”
The*ln way of the just is*i uprightness; O*ld Most Upright, You*ld weigh the path of the just.
Yes,*ld in the way of Your judgments, O*ld Lord,*s we have waited for You; The*ld desire of our*i soul is*i for Your name And*ld for the remembrance of You.

With*ld my soul I have desired You in the night, Yes,*ld by my spirit within me I will seek You early; For*ld when Your judgments are*i in the earth, The*ld inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.
Let*ld grace be shown to the wicked, Yet*ild he will not learn righteousness; In*ld the land of uprightness he will deal unjustly, And*ld will not behold the majesty of the Lord.*s
Lord,*sld when*i Your hand is lifted up, they will not see. But*ld they will see and be ashamed For*ld their*i envy of people; Yes,*ld the fire of Your enemies shall devour them.
Lord,*sln You will establish peace for us, For*ld You have also done all our works in us.
O*ld Lord*s our God, masters besides You Have*ld had dominion over us; But*ild by You only we make mention of Your name.
They*ild are*i dead, they will not live; They*ild are*i deceased, they will not rise. Therefore*ld You have punished and destroyed them, And*ld made all their memory to perish.
You*ld have increased the nation, O Lord,*s You*ld have increased the nation; You*ld are glorified; You*ld have expanded all the borders of the land.
Lord,*sln in trouble they have visited You, They*ld poured out a prayer when*i Your chastening was*i upon them.
As*ld a woman with child Is*ld in pain and cries out in her pangs, When*ild she draws near the time of her delivery, So*ld have we been in Your sight, O Lord.*s

We*ld have been with child, we have been in pain; We*ld have, as it were, brought forth wind; We*ld have not accomplished any deliverance in the earth, Nor*ld have the inhabitants of the world fallen.

Your*ln dead shall live; Together*ild with*i my dead body they shall arise. Awake*ld and sing, you who dwell in dust; For*ld your dew is*i like*i the dew of herbs, And*ld the earth shall cast out the dead.
Take Refuge from the Coming Judgment
Come,*pn my people, enter your chambers, And*ld shut your doors behind you; Hide*ld yourself, as it were, for a little moment, Until*ld the indignation is past.
For*ld behold, the Lord*s comes out of His place To*ld punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity; The*ld earth will also disclose her blood, And*ld will no more cover her slain.
